page.title: 03Crowton Hall Farm
page.content: Crowton Hall is a large dairy farm of 120 hectares. The farm is owned by the Wilbraham Estate and Mr. Stubbs is the tenant. Mr. Stubbs keeps 200 cattle and 600 sheep. He buys sheep after the harvest to feed on the barley fields and then he sells them in the spring for meat. The farm has 100 Friesian cows which are milked in a parlour. Concentrates are fed automatically and one man can milk 80 cows an hour. A good cow will give 6000 litres of milk in a lactation. After birth calves are kept with the cow for 3 days and then they are fed dried milk and concentrates. The heifers are kept to replace the milking herd and the bulls are sold for meat at 11 months old. Cereal crops and grass are grown for cattle feed. Silage is made for winter feed.
